title: Rotational kinematics - sphere displacement at 2 s

content.description: A sphere rotates about an axis passing through its center. The angular velocity, <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math>, of the sphere in <math alttext="radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>rad/s</mtext></math> is given by the following equations, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is the time in seconds.
content.question: <math alttext="Line 1: omega equals 4, 0 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 1. Line 2: omega equals the fraction 4 over t squared, end fraction, t is greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mi>ω</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>ω</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math> What is the angular displacement of the sphere at time <math alttext="t equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> seconds?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
